description.narrative: -Register SearNeT network as a legal entity -Have a minimum of three proposals submitted to a variety of funding organizations -Provide trainings to both artisans and professionals of RWH, Publish research on successful RWH stories and properly documenting at -least five international case studies on RWH in close collaboration with RAIN -Provide networking services for exchange of information, knowledge and awareness raising on RWH. -Promote RWH on (inter)national fora - Disseminate and promote RWH for food security, through five press releases, two policy briefs, 10 newsletters and eight visits to local line ministries of water, agriculture and Environmental resources; -RAIN, SearNeT and their members shall promote far-reaching cooperation between the organisations involved in RWH in West Africa, Eastern and Southern Africa and South (East) Asia.
Develop a framework for co-operation to boost RWH for food security by bringing together a diversity of knowledge, experiences and lessons drawn from “key-actors” in Southern and Eastern Africa.
Effective fundraising at different levels (governmental, private sector and community) in order to increase access to water through RWH;
Exchange knowledge and expertise concerning RWH between the participants and members of their networks;
Increase the capacity of local and regional RWH actors in order to facilitate implementation and knowledge concerning RWH projects.
RAIN and SEARNET will increase awareness on RWH at local, national and international levels to promote RWH as a significant complement to conventional systems of watermanagement;

RAIN foundation and SearNet have formed partnership to enlarge their networks and to join forces in promoting RWH. They will collaborate in strengthening their mutual activities. Both Participants are aware that they can complement each other in order to reach the mutual goal of promoting RWH.

RAIN foundation and SearNet work on the areas of rain water harvesting (RWH).The Rainwater Harvesting Implementation Network (RAIN) is a global network, which focuses on global implementation of RWH structures and capacity building on the ground. SEARNET is a network of registered non-profit member rainwater harvesting (RWH) associations whose primary objective is to promote rainwater in their respective countries and the Sub-Saharan region.
Registration of SearNet as a legal entity.
The project aims to bring together a diversity of RWH key actors with focus on Southern and Eastern Africa.
